result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip John Metcalf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation: Costs $ 443.00,   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge.

miscConds.notes: $243.00 costs plus $ 200.00 DNA Surcharge   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent
Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge.

judgments.dispoDesc:
Court withholds sentence, imposes 2 years probation, complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge. plus court costs of $ 243.00. Probation to be served concurrent with 15CM296 and 16CM122.   Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.
Count # 2 is dismissed and read-in.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 12, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts
DEF pleads NC to Count #1.
Court finds DEF has made plea, willingly, freely and intelligently.
Court accepts plea, finds DEF guilty. 
ADA Marcoux argues sentence. Atty McLaughlin argues sentence.
Court withholds sentence, imposes 2 years probation, complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge. plus court costs of $ 243.00. Probation to be served concurrent with 15CM296 and 16CT91.   Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.
Count # 2 is dismissed and read-in.
